intro: Castilleja × cognata, commonly known as the hybrid Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic plant that belongs to the Orobanchaceae family. It is native to the western United States and grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. The plant features showy, bright red or orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, resembling a paintbrush. Its roots form symbiotic relationships with the roots of neighboring plants, drawing nutrients from them. Castilleja × cognata plays a role in supporting pollinators and contributes to the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
